Indicates if the from and to properties of sent and received envelopes should be filled with the session information if not defined.

The timeout to close the channel due to inactivity.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The transport to be used by the channel.
The channel send timeout. Each send operation must be completed in the specified timeout or it will be canceled.

The number of envelopes to be buffered internally by the channel in the receive operations. If this limit is reached, the channel will not consume the transport until the buffer is consumed by the receive operations.
if set to true [fill envelope recipients].
Indicates if the channel should reply automatically to ping request commands. In this case, the ping command are not returned by the ReceiveCommandAsync method.
Indicates if the client should automatically send 'received' notifications for messages.
The interval to ping the remote party.
The timeout to close the channel due to inactivity.
The channel consume timeout. Each envelope received from the transport must be consumed in the specified interval or it will cause the channel to be closed.

Each handler must return true if the failure was handled and a channel should be created again or false if not, which causes the exception to be thrown to the caller. The default action is the recreation of a channel. If a single handler return false, no channel will not be recreated.

member.name: P:Lime.Protocol.Client.IOnDemandClientChannel.ChannelOperationFailedHandlers
member.summary: Gets the channel operation failed handlers, which are called when the channel fails during an operation. Each handler must return true if the failure was handled and a channel should be created again or false if not, which causes the exception to be thrown to the caller. The default action is the recreation of a channel. If a single handler return false, no channel will not be recreated.

member.summary: Notify the destination about a change in the resource value of the sender. If the resource value is absent, it represent that the resource in the specified URI was deleted in the originator. This method is one way and the destination SHOULD NOT send a response for it. Because of that, a command envelope with this method MAY NOT have an id.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The transport to be used by the channel.
The channel send timeout. Each send operation must be completed in the specified timeout or it will be canceled.

The number of envelopes to be buffered internally by the channel in the receive operations. If this limit is reached, the channel will not consume the transport until the buffer is consumed by the receive operations.
Indicates if the channel should reply automatically to ping request commands. In this case, the ping command are not returned by the ReceiveCommandAsync method.
The interval to ping the remote party.
The timeout to close the channel due to inactivity.
The channel consume timeout. Each envelope received from the transport must be consumed in the specified interval or it will cause the channel to be closed.

member.summary: Encryption options provided by the server during the session negotiation.

member.summary: The encryption option selected for the session. This property is provided by the client in the negotiation and by the server in the confirmation after that.

member.name: P:Lime.Protocol.Session.CompressionOptions
member.summary: Compression options provided by the server during the session negotiation.

member.name: P:Lime.Protocol.Session.Compression
member.summary: The compression option selected for the session. This property is provided by the client in the negotiation and by the server in the confirmation after that.

member.name: P:Lime.Protocol.Session.SchemeOptions
member.summary: List of available authentication schemas for session authentication provided by the server.

member.name: P:Lime.Protocol.Session.Scheme
member.summary: The authentication scheme option selected for the session. This property must be present if the property authentication is defined.

member.name: P:Lime.Protocol.Session.Authentication
member.summary: Authentication data, related to the selected schema. Information like password sent by the client or roundtrip data sent by the server.

member.name: P:Lime.Protocol.Session.Reason
member.summary: In cases where the client receives a session with failed state, this property should provide more details about the problem.

member.name: T:Lime.Protocol.SessionState
member.summary: Defines the supported session states

member.name: F:Lime.Protocol.SessionState.New
member.summary: The session is new and doesn't exists an established context. It is sent by a client node to start a session with a server.

member.name: F:Lime.Protocol.SessionState.Negotiating
member.summary: The server and the client are negotiating the session options, like cryptography and compression. The server sends to the client the options (if available) and the client chooses the desired options. If there's no options (for instance, if the connection is already encrypted or the transport protocol doesn't support these options), the server SHOULD skip the negotiation.

member.name: F:Lime.Protocol.SessionState.Authenticating
member.summary: The session is being authenticated. The server sends to the client the available authentication schemes list and the client must choose one and send the specific authentication data. The authentication can occurs in multiple roundtrips, according to the selected schema.

member.name: F:Lime.Protocol.SessionState.Established
member.summary: The session is active and it is possible to send and receive messages and commands. The server sends this state after the session was authenticated.

member.name: F:Lime.Protocol.SessionState.Finishing
member.summary: The client node is requesting to the server to finish the session.

member.name: F:Lime.Protocol.SessionState.Finished
member.summary: The session was gracefully finished by the server.

member.name: F:Lime.Protocol.SessionState.Failed
member.summary: A problem occurred while the session was established, under negotiation or authentication and it was closed by the server. In this case, the property reason MUST be present to provide more details about the problem.
